Automated Machine Learning with H2O (II)

Author

Gani Cem TÃ¼remen

1 Challenge Summary

For the challenge, we shall be working with a Product Backorders dataset. The goal here is to predict whether or not a product will be put on backorder status, given a number of product metrics such as current inventory, transit time, demand forecasts and prior sales. Itâs a classic Binary Classification problem.

2 Objectives

Apply your learning of H2O Automated Machine Learning to predict backorder status.

3 Solution

3.1 Import Libraries

library(tidyverse)
library(recipes)
library(rsample)
library(readxl)
library(h2o)

3.2 Load the training & test dataset

product_backorders_tbl <- read_csv("data/product_backorders.csv")

product_backorders_tbl %>% glimpse()

#> $ min_bank          <dbl> 0, 0, 10, 0, 2, 51, 33, 4, 2, 0, 0, 0, 3, 4, 0, 0, 0â¦
#> $ potential_issue   <chr> "No", "No", "No", "No", "No", "No", "No", "No", "No"â¦

#> $ perf_6_month_avg  <dbl> 0.90, 0.96, 0.81, 0.96, 0.98, 0.00, 1.00, 0.69, 1.00â¦
#> $ perf_12_month_avg <dbl> 0.89, 0.97, 0.88, 0.98, 0.98, 0.00, 0.97, 0.68, 0.95â¦
#> $ local_bo_qty      <dbl> 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 34, 0, 0, 7, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, â¦
#> $ deck_risk         <chr> "No", "No", "No", "No", "No", "No", "No", "No", "No"â¦
#> $ oe_constraint     <chr> "No", "No", "No", "No", "No", "No", "No", "No", "No"â¦
#> $ ppap_risk         <chr> "No", "No", "No", "No", "No", "Yes", "No", "No", "Noâ¦
#> $ stop_auto_buy     <chr> "Yes", "Yes", "Yes", "Yes", "Yes", "Yes", "Yes", "Yeâ¦
#> $ rev_stop          <chr> "No", "No", "No", "No", "No", "No", "No", "No", "No"â¦
#> $ went_on_backorder <chr> "Yes", "Yes", "Yes", "Yes", "Yes", "Yes", "Yes", "Yeâ¦
set.seed(seed = 777)
split_obj <- initial_split(product_backorders_tbl, prop = 0.80)

train_set_tbl <- training(split_obj)
test_set_tbl  <- testing(split_obj)
recipe_obj <- recipe(went_on_backorder ~., data = train_set_tbl) %>% 
  step_zv(all_predictors()) %>% 
  step_mutate_at(potential_issue,
                 deck_risk,
                 oe_constraint,
                 ppap_risk,
                 stop_auto_buy,
                 rev_stop,
                 went_on_backorder,
                 fn = as.factor) %>% 
  prep()

train_tbl <- bake(recipe_obj, new_data = train_set_tbl)
test_tbl  <- bake(recipe_obj, new_data = test_set_tbl)

train_tbl %>% glimpse()

#> Columns: 23

#> $ went_on_backorder <fct> No, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, Noâ¦

3.3 Specify the response and predictor variables

h2o.init()

split_h2o <- h2o.splitFrame(as.h2o(train_tbl), ratios = c(0.80), seed = 767)
train_h2o <- split_h2o[[1]]
valid_h2o <- split_h2o[[2]]
test_h2o  <- as.h2o(test_tbl)

y <- "went_on_backorder"
x <- setdiff(names(train_h2o), y)

3.4 Run AutoML specifying the stopping criterion

automl_models_h2o <- h2o.automl(
  x = x,
  y = y,
  training_frame    = train_h2o,
  validation_frame  = valid_h2o,
  leaderboard_frame = test_h2o,
  max_runtime_secs  = 60,
  nfolds            = 5 
)

3.5 View the leaderboard

automl_models_h2o@leaderboard
#>                                                  model_id       auc   logloss
#> 1    StackedEnsemble_AllModels_1_AutoML_1_20230602_153206 0.9434092 0.1814100
#> 2 StackedEnsemble_BestOfFamily_2_AutoML_1_20230602_153206 0.9424741 0.1830483
#> 3                          GBM_1_AutoML_1_20230602_153206 0.9421039 0.1849211
#> 4 StackedEnsemble_BestOfFamily_1_AutoML_1_20230602_153206 0.9420608 0.1835529
#> 5                          GBM_4_AutoML_1_20230602_153206 0.9414669 0.1969647
#> 6                          GBM_3_AutoML_1_20230602_153206 0.9360941 0.2023744

#> 
#> [10 rows x 7 columns]

3.6 Predicting using Leader Model

leader_model <- automl_models_h2o@leaderboard %>% 
  extract_h2o_model_name_by_position(1) %>% 
  h2o.getModel()
#> StackedEnsemble_AllModels_1_AutoML_1_20230602_153206
predictions <- h2o.predict(leader_model, newdata = as.h2o(test_tbl))

predictions_tbl <- predictions %>% as_tibble()

predictions_tbl %>% glimpse()
#> Rows: 3,811
#> Columns: 3
#> $ predict <fct> Yes, Yes, Yes, Yes, Yes, Yes, Yes, Yes, Yes, Yes, Yes, Yes, Yeâ¦
#> $ No      <dbl> 0.46939312, 0.10956838, 0.12959951, 0.44516257, 0.56051457, 0.â¦
#> $ Yes     <dbl> 0.53060688, 0.89043162, 0.87040049, 0.55483743, 0.43948543, 0.â¦

3.7 Save the leader model

leader_model %>% h2o.saveModel(path = "h2o_models/")
